alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Grayson; Hancock; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:28AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HANCOCK... NORTHWESTERN GRAYSON...SOUTHWESTERN BRECKINRIDGE AND NORTHERN OHIO COUNTIES THROUGH 315 AM CDT... At 228 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Masonville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Fordsville, Taffy, Ralph, Shreve, Pellville, Magan, Tar Fork, Pleasant Ridge, Cabot and Vanzant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Louisville.
